name: Sails in the Desert Ayers Rock Resort

reviews.text: This hotel has fantastic location, beautiful, clean front desk and lobby and polite, professional people working for it. It also has spacious rooms and clean bedlinen, decent showers. However we were unpleasantly surprised by the dark mildew growing between the shower tiles, mysterious dark spots on the room ceilings and walls, grey insulation material visibly hanging between the suspended bathroom ceiling and the wall and the heavily stained ,once white window shears. We rented 2 rooms and they looked identical. They also both had the same, heavy, musty air. This is a 5 star hotel that charges accordingly. We were hoping for higher standards.
reviews.title: No competition leads to relaxing standards.

reviews.text: We have just returned home after 4 days of wonderful experiances,Want to thank the staff of the Sails in the Desert for their friendly and helpful service,I travelled with my husband, best friend,grandson and friend,and we found the rooms surficient for our needs.Clean and comfortable, with good air con.We have travelled to many countries,and although mabey people expect more from a 5 star hotel,there should remember where they are,In the Red Center of our beautiful country.The restarant prices were expensive, but there are alternatives in Yulara,a little cheaper,Although we did have a nice meal there in the hotel at a reasonable price,The Tali Bar,which as it says has a bar.but the price of wine was over the top,at $ 40 odd dollers a bottle,Coffee and tea making facilaties,were good,which were important to us,we have stayed in places overseas where there is no such thing.
reviews.title: Magical Trip

reviews.text: The Sounds OF Silence dinner under the stars,althoug expensive at $165,was well worth it for me.We viewed the sunset over Ullaru with champagne and canapes,of Crocadile,Kangaroo, and smoked salmon.Then down to dinner at tables laid with white cloths and crystal,under tall gas heaters,we didn't feel at all cold.One of the highlights for me was seeing the planet Saturn with its rings through one of the telescopes at our disposal.
reviews.title: Not a bulls eye in the red centre

reviews.text: All in all was a wonderful adventure,thank you Voygers.We did hire a car, and appriciated the freedom it gave us.
reviews.title: Had a comfortable stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this 5-star hotel but accommodation options are plenty to suit your budget at Ayers Rock Resort and if I went again, I wouldn't bother staying at Sails in the Desert. Staying here was not really worth the money since we spent most of our time in the national park and I'd have preferred the rustic charm of the Outback Pioneer Hotel and Lodge or a cabin in the camping area, and had some extra cash leftover. Service at the hotel was also fairly ordinary. We found the staff to be fairly vague and room service not that great. Skip the 'fancy' restaurant in the hotel, Winkiku is quite expensive and quality just isn't there. We dined at Kuniya Restaurant which was fine and probably the best in terms of quality and value. If you're wanting all the luxury trimmings of overly priced dining, swimming pool and spa treatments, then it's your only option. But we agreed it wasn't overly impressive.
reviews.title: Overpriced, but probably your best bet

reviews.text: I am so pleased we spent the three nights we were in Yulura staying at Sails in the Desert. From check in to check out we were made to feel welcome. All the staff we dealt with were very friendly and always willing to help in any way they could. I would recommend getting the breakfast as part of your accommodation deal as it is really good with lots of options. You can have your eggs cooked how you like or even an omelette or pancakes. We also ate in the restaurant for one evening meal as the other two nights we were doing other activities. We all enjoyed the selection of food on offer. The kids loved the chocolate fountain!! The resort itself was clean and even though there were many guests it was always quiet. We loved the white ghost gums in the courtyard area near the pool.
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay

reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at ... The front lobby, gardens and pool are a miracle in the middle of The Outback. Staff are friendly, welcoming and professional with every request promptly answered. My early arrival was quickly accommodated and luggage was waiting in my spacious, well appointed poolside room ... a comfortable bed and large, spotless bathroom were appreciated after a full day in the hot desert. Complimentary Internet was available in the Reception Lobby and restaurant. Expensive, yes ... worth it, absolutely!
reviews.title: Magic in The Red Centre!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our Easter break in Uluru and stayed at Sails in the Desert. The general area is absolutely breathtaking! It was my third time there (the first two times - years ago - we camped) and I cannot stress enough how worthwhile a trip to the Red Centre is.
reviews.title: Some hiccups, but okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our time at Sails was generally okay. The room was clean and the bed was actually pretty wonderful (especially after a day of hiking). The bathroom could have been better designed (shower over bath, with a shower curtain...what's with shower curtains in purportedly upmarket hotels?!?).
reviews.title: Red Desert

reviews.text: Food was ridiculously pricey. I was just lucky my partner and I could enjoy half priced meals thanks to our Accor Advantage Plus card. Otherwise, a simple burger with fries would set you back $27. As a foodie, I was also concerned by the menu stating things like "Wagyu beef steak sandwich". Provenance and accuracy are hugely important to me when it comes to food...and I can assure you the steak was not Wagyu. Similarly, we ordered a cured meat platter one night. The menu stated it should come with 4 different types of pretty delicious sounding meats. We were brought what looked like cheap supermarket ham and some slices of prosciutto...
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - staff trying very hard

reviews.text: This is one of the most wonderful hotels in the world, just completed 34 day cruise around OZ with stay overs in Abu Dhabi at 5 star hotels, no comparison in service, fine food and fantastic surroundings, we had at this hotel, crisp clean bedding on wonderful comfy beds, class terrace furniture, views to die for, warm welcome with iced apply juice and chilled face cloths to mop our brows what more can one ask for, its the place I will be returning too.
reviews.title: Top Class

reviews.text: im very angry with all the negative comments about Sails. We stayed 5 nights over the xmas period. and enjoyed every minute. For people to say its run down must not realise that it hasnt rained there since February, and being in the desert over 40 degress things are going to be a bit dusty and dirty. and it doesn't matter how often the staff sweep the paths Australian Gum Trees drop leaves all the time.OK so the food is a bit expensive, but they have to get it from South Australia. so that adds to the cost. If your worried about the cost go and stay at the camping ground and buy and cook your own food. The Staff: all the staff we met were more than helpful and friendly, They are all there because they want to be, living in shared accomadation. I found they all were well exprienced in what they did. The breakfast staff all professional and friendly. Simone cooking eggs and bacon just the way we wanted. with a smile the whole time. I found Sails to be just what we wanted somewhere to do nothing except relax and enjoy good food.
reviews.title: give them a break

reviews.text: Nothing about this hotel is 5 star yes the rooms have been done up but the bathrooms seemed to have been missed out and have stained toilets and baths. A five star hotel should have 5 star facilities and service neither were present at the sails. A run down pool area with no pool towels, no gym, slow pool bar service which left us with our lunch plates still sitting on our table 3 hours later, disorganised staff which meant that they forgot our packed breakfast on one of our early morning starts. If you a used to staying in 5 star hotels this is probably the best place to stay unless you want to pay the $2000 per night for longitude 131 but its the best of a bad bunch.
reviews.title: In no way a 5 star hotel...3 star at the very best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Sails, but it was not worth the high price tag.
reviews.title: Nice hotel room, but not worth the price tag.

reviews.text: The rooms are modern, resembling rooms I'd stay at in Vegas. The one gripe I have about the room--the bed sheets are rough.
reviews.title: Take it for what it is...

reviews.text: We stayed here for a conference.
reviews.title: An outback experience

reviews.text: The room looked out onto the desert. As there had been lots of rain there were a few bugs and lizards etc around. No real problem.
reviews.title: Loved It!

likes.liked: — Loved the staff - helpful and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and service were good. Buffets were provided as part of the conference.
reviews.title: Impressive looking hotel which we loved.

reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable, we slept well. The Shower Curtain was too short, so everytime we had a shower the bathroom floor flooded!!
reviews.title: Amazing Rock

reviews.text: Every visitor to Australia should visit Uluru and Kata Tjuta!
reviews.title: An oasis of cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a comfortable stay here in a deluxe room. Everything was clean and the room was large. Inside the hotel the public areas are very modern, clean and comfortable. However whilst we appreciate it is in the middle of nowhere it doesn't live up to it's rating. It lacks that extra something which makes a top hotel and we felt that the prices charged were very, very inflated. It is worth noting that not all the restaurants advertised are actually operating either. The pool was clean, but the area surrounding it was not kept well - dirty towels and plastic cups abandoned where people had left them and not cleared away.
reviews.title: Very nice but not worth the high prices

reviews.text: It is certainly a good place to stay if visiting Ayer's Rock.
reviews.title: loved everything about the sails in the dessert

reviews.text: could not say a bad word about the resort, the staff were always friendly and helpful, different area of the resort were easy to find, located in a very goood spot right next door to town centre. could not have enjoyed my stay any more then i did. perfect getaway.
reviews.title: Amazing 5star resort in remote location

reviews.text: We stayed at Sails in the Desert for 3 nights from 21-24 April at the end of an extensive camping trip through Central Australia. The hotel is spectacular wwith beautiful gardens. The recent makeover by Voyages has benn very successful in delivering very attractive public spaces and large well appointed guest rooms which all reflect the culture and natural environments of this region
reviews.title: Great service in a remote location

reviews.text: The art works in the Gallery and public areas are amazing. We found all the staff to be very friendly and also very professional in their service delivery. The restaurant service and food was of high quality. We were particularly impressed with the dinner buffet, where two chefs would cook a choice of mains options to order and these would then be served at your table. We. We're slightly disappointed tha the hotel signatures restaurant is not opening until July as we would have liked to try it. We enjoyed the Sounds of Silence Sunset Dinner.
reviews.title: Great interlude

reviews.text: Stayed here over the Easter weekend with my husband and nine year old daughter. We shared one room with two queen beds in it. Plenty of room and lovely outlook over the gum trees. Really couldn't fault the accomodation. It rained here over Easter which is very unusual in the Centre and most activities are planned around it not raining. Both our night time events were cancelled which was a shame but the staff worked hard to make up for it. Of course nothing could make up for losing out on the night sky in the centre but what could they do about the rain and the cloud cover? Lovely aroma though from the gum trees in the rain.
reviews.title: Good for family visit to Uluru

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a very well run but yes sterile compound in the middle of nowhere. I can't really think for a family trip to the Centre how else you would do it but I think a swag bag on top of a 4wd would be a more 'authentic' way to see the Rock. But then if that's not your flavour this is for you!
reviews.title: Poor facilities

reviews.text: Arrived Sunday allocated room on third floor. Sunday was the only day the lift worked and despite notifying staff no one seemed to be aware the lift was not working as no mechanic had been called by the time we checked out on Thursday.
reviews.title: Full marks for trying.

reviews.text: The only facilities were a pool with paint chipped off the floor and a tennis court. I ordered a long black coffee from the restaurant and was served a cup of brown muck which rated as the worst coffee I have ever been served.
reviews.title: Too HOT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite spacious and well appointed. For some reason you could get one hour free Internet if you wanted to sit in the lobby but if you wanted to use it in your room you had to pay for it.
reviews.title: great 3 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW! Where do I start? From check-in to check-out we were blown away by the level of service and care every member of your team extended to us! Even the bus transfer from the airport to the hotel and vice versa was brilliant and the drivers made us smile so much with their warmth and sincerity!
reviews.title: Unbelievable way to spend our Anniversary!!!

reviews.text: We dealt with both Kathy and Melissa via email when making our initial booking enquiry and both were so lovely and made everything so easy, from making our tour bookings for us via email and even making our dinner reservation at Mayu! We didn't have to lift a finger!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay Again !!

reviews.text: The lovely lady who checked us in was so friendly and thorough. Even though she was training a new girl (it was her very first day) and she must have had a lot on her plate, she didn't miss a beat and every possible detail was looked after and explained to us, including confirming our tour pick-up times. The new girl was also very sweet and we hope she is going well with her training!
reviews.title: Upmarket Rooms - Terrific Location

reviews.text: Our Terrace Room was unbelievable! And we cannot thank you enough for the beautiful card and complimentary bottle of sparkling to celebrate our anniversary :) it was so unexpected honestly made us feel so special and grateful.
reviews.title: Showing it's Age but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then, I can't even begin to tell you how amazing our dinner at Mayu was on our first night in the Red Centre! Everything was faultless and the food was to-die-for, we are struggling to think of a meal we've had in a restaurant anywhere that was better! Our lovely attendant for the evening was Yasmin and she is a superstar! She made us laugh and looked after us above and beyond, including bringing us out a plate, prepared by the Chef, of chocolates surrounding the words Happy 10th Anniversary! We couldn't believe it :)
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
Fantastic five star resort
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and loved this resort. It is beautiful after the reverb 6 months ago. The hotel has had a complete make over and looks stunning. The other options here looked very disappointing.
The pool, was lovely and peaceful and very relaxing.
reviews.title: First time at Ayers Rock

reviews.text: The service was great and the food delicious. Make sure your rate includes breakfast as the buffet breakfast was great.
reviews.title: Nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 3rd floor with views of the rock.
reviews.title: Would most definately come back!
No complaints whatsoever!
reviews.text: We will stay here again and as for expense it is very reasonable given the isolation from any major city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drove from Alice down to Uluru via the Mereenie Loop and this was the last stop on our trip having stopped at Alice, Glen Helen and Kings Canyon previously.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but this was by far the best hotel on our trip. Very nicely done on the inside, good staff, beautiful rooms, good mini bar choice/ snacks in the room. We didn't eat in the hotel but the restaurant choices looked very good.
reviews.title: Really enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only grumble was that the rooms were poorly signed around the reception area and we spent about 10mins walking around trying to find the right direction to the room (not helped by the key card not working when we finally found the room).
reviews.title: Idyllic location, wonderful weather (not too hot!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the expensive side (on a par with Kings Canyon) but soooo much nicer!
reviews.title: The Outback At Its Best!

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Clearly you are paying top dollar but considering the remote location this was definitely worth it. The service was good and the room was spacious and well equipped. The pool was excellent - and very tempting in the 37 degree heat.  We found the free washing machines to be an unexpected bonus!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: We stayed Sails for 2 nights. Basically took a flight from Sydney to Ayers Rock, and rented a car at the Airport. This hotel is about 7 KM from the airport, and an easy drive. Nice lobby and courteous service. Rooms were clean and spacious. Parking was a little out of the way. So if you have heavy bags to lug, leave it to the bell boys :)
reviews.title: Pricey but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was a nice stay, but we thougt it was a bit too expensive ($300 per night).
reviews.title: Great food, atmosphere and facilities

reviews.text: We had a great time here this month and enjoyed everything the hotel had to offer. Friendly efficient staff, spacious well equipped rooms and great dining. Kuniya Restaurant and Winkiku for dinner were great, offering dining at either end of the scale, with excellent service at both. The pool looked fantastic and heated, which was needed on the 13 degree days we stayed. Don't forget to lock away your chocolate biscuits at night, the little mice will find them! Yulara is a tribute to the ingenuity of the owners and staff to create such an oasis way out back.
reviews.title: Great Time in the Desert

reviews.text: The hotel was excellent, a great place to come back to after a day out around Uluru and the Olgas.
reviews.title: Great location, needs a make over

reviews.text: There is something magic about a trip to Uluru which tends to put a positive spin on some of the other shortcomings that our Yulara accommodation offered. If this resort was not advertised as 5 star, with prices to match, then perhaps I'd be even more forgiving. The buildings and amenities are tired and desperate for an overhaul, which i was told is to happen soon and would certainly make me more inclined to revisit.
reviews.title: Great location! Great place!

reviews.text: The reviews here seem quite mixed and I suppose I can understand why to an extent.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a breath-taking part of the world

reviews.text: We booked this hotel as part of an all-in package including flights so actually I felt we had reasonable value for money, however, certainly once at the resort it is expensive so do bear this in mind.
reviews.title: A relaxing hotel in the heart of the desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very spacious, nicely designed and clean, over-looking the gardens and pool area. The gardens are nicely maintained and provide a nice green oasis within the desert. The pool is very large but this was perhaps one area where a little attention could be paid to by the hotel. Quite a number of the tiles were cracked and it didn't feel as clean and well cared for as perhaps it could. We also used the pool-side bar for drinks and snacks and again it could be said that the tables and chairs were a bit lacking in attention to detail that could have made this area more attractive.
reviews.title: Unreliable, Pretentious Staff and Management

reviews.text: Having said this the hotel was very nice and the staff were all extremely polite and helpful. I couldn't find fault with this and so as such I would recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Two worlds

reviews.text: There are not many hotels to chose from at Ayers Rock (Uluru). The rooms were adequate. I wish the air conditioning could work a bit better. Do not get a corner room. It will be very hot since it will have 2 exposures. My sister had one and had to have it changed ( and we weren't there in the heart of the summer). The restaurant was very pleasant and the wait staff was very very good for dinner. Breakfast is buffet style and you have to flag down a waiter to get your coffee or tea.
reviews.title: best hotel in ayers rock resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel and good rating, but rooms not very clean, carpets dirty and full of what insects I dread to think, Pool not clean all dead leaves floating on the top. the dining area was always emoy as the prices were ridiculous so went around to the super market at the back not a lot of choice, but could cope for a couple of nights, the reception area was very nice and clean, shame the rooms were not the same.
reviews.title: Very Poor Very Disappointing

reviews.text: Family holiday.8 and 10 year old loved the pool and the tennis courts.........travelled with my mum and dad who came over from NZ.Food was very good considering such an isolated location and was good value.Staff were very good especially in the town centre. I tried to spend 6k on air tours for family.....they cancelled due to weather......and then never tried to rebook us......care factor zero with flight tours. Many examples available for day and night tours available.......worth 2 holidays over 10 year period.booked direct and all hotel related promises were delivered.Travelled June 2010.
reviews.title: Stunning destination...wonderful staff..........important for family education.

reviews.text: Unbelievable. Front desk ammeters. Food inedible. Waiters call you wankers. Rooms old mouldy dusty mice ridden. Not 5 star. No DVD. No cd. Housekeeping haphasad. Blankets torn. Sheets stained. Dust gathering on ancient tv. No safe in room. Shower in bath. Avoid at all costs.
reviews.title: Waste of money

reviews.text: we booked 3 rms here, and were very impressed with the overall look of the hotel grounds,as well as the rooms. Our guides room had mice though, and they changed rooms for him, and luckily, we didnt see any (same problem at many hotels in the outback it seems). We really didnt have much time there, but would have liked to spend some time in the pool. had a couple of drinks in the bar, but, prices were very high for food and drinks, as we had expected. not sure if we would return to this hotel, based on the cost. loved uluru and had a great camel ride while in the area.
reviews.title: impressive hotel, but expensive

reviews.text: Getting this hotel on the Cudo special deal with worth it but i certainly would not pay their normal rates as it is not a 5 star hotel. The staff were pleasant and tried hard but you did sense that there isnt very good leadership motivating and directing the staff. The food choices were limited and very overpriced even allowing for goods to be shipped in from Alice Springs.The. pool and lobby areas are very nice including the artist in residence who was a delight to talk too. The sounds of silence dinner whilst a nice experience is frankly a bit of a rip off - i would not recommend it for non drinkers as you wont get your $160.00 worth. Another major rip off are the trips into the national park, highly recommend hiring a car and doing it yourself . Highly recommend the helicopter flights - expensive but so worth it, wish we did that before any of the walking tours as the helicopter flight showed you so much more and was one of the few activities worth its price tag. Moral of the story for Aussies wanting to see the Red Centre - wait for a special deal on hotel and flights as everything else costs more than what you would pay overseas !!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not 5 star

reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic mini holiday at the Sails, we booked the superior room, 2 queen sized beds, very comfy, air con worked well thank goodness as it was so hot. The staff are very friendly, so no complaints there but the service in the Walpa lobby bar was very average. I ordered the seafood platter and it was inedible, rubbery, tasteless and i understand that seafood would have been frozen but i think a light grill with some tasty marinade perhaps? not even a slice of lemon. We had to constantly hassle staff for our 8 year olds meal, then no drinks, then the chocolate ice cream dessert, after we pestered to get it, came with no chocolate. The whole place had a very disorganised feel to it. The poor woman who cooks the pancakes and omelettes for breakfast has to do so on an electric cook top, slow and or burns and copped abuse from a lot of hungry impatient tourists. We enquired about a trip with the desk and did not hear back from them, so hired a car instead, then received a bill for the trip anyway. They reversed the charge readily. Ordered room service kids fish and chips and got soggy chips and a large lump of thick fish, grey coloured, think maybe steamed, nothing a child would eat! The pool was very clean. The staff appear to have made peace with the inconsistency in their service and complaints, at the desk and in the eating areas and chatting to other tourists show there were a lot. But we had a great time anyway. the whole experience was awesome, hire a car is my big tip, cheap and you can easily access everything you want to see by the fantastic roads. Uluru, Kata Tjuta, the Cultural Centre, take advantage of the free activities in the town square, walking distance from any accommodation or by free shuttle. Sounds of Silence dinner, again a memorable experience, a must.
reviews.title: Great stay but the service could improve

reviews.text: This hotel chosen as the base for a visit to Central Australia when I was accompanied by VIP's in my organisation who are based in the US.Our stay was in September and I have delayed doing a review because our experience was so completely disappointing that I did not wish to lodge something as a knee-jerk reaction.
reviews.title: My overseas friends won't be coming back here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were completely ignored by the 3 or 4 staff on arrival and had to drag our cases 100's of metres to our rooms unassisted.
reviews.title: Nothing special, but you're not there for the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was undergoing construction and this was in the small print on the booking but they failed to mention that there would be no bar or restaurant with air-conditioning in the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Oasis in the Desert

reviews.text: 30 or so guests waiting for their rooms after we had arrived were directed to wait at the pool bar where the temperature was around 100 degrees. No staff assisted these people to find shade so my friends and I moved some tables into the very limited shady area for them.
reviews.title: A bucket list item for sure would go back again!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sails for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. Our room price was $340 including breakfast. Whilst others have complained about the prices, one must realize how much it costs to operate a remote resort. Every employee needs to have housing provided either free or greatly subsidised in addition to a wage that keeps employees in a remote area. Additionally the resort bus, free activities, the high cost of providing energy and water all has to be figured into the room rate. The beautiful grounds, lobby all come at a price. In this respect, the local highway chain hotel such as in the USA is of far less value in that they provide nothing except a room. Some who review here and claim to be world travellers, must look beyond the room itself to see value.
reviews.title: A Great Value

reviews.text: The room was newly fitted and was on par with most high-end resorts. The mattress was one of the best I have ever slept on. Linens were high quality as well, which is where most lux resorts fall short. Mini bar could have been stocked better. In room movies were pricy but TV worked well and was HD signal. The exterior of the building was in good condition but not high end by any means. There are several free activities to partake of and beautiful grounds and outlooks to enjoy. The pool was large, clean and inviting. We had room service and the food was good but not in any way outstanding. The breakfast buffet was diverse and some items were cooked to order. Overall prices were fair considering the remote location. Definitely in line with Melbourne where we currently reside.
reviews.title: Travel to uluru with a one year old in tow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall service was very good with all requests honoured and completed promptly. Our only negative would be the overall cleanliness of the grounds and pool area. At most upscale resorts that I have been to, walkways patios etc are swept regularly and neat. We very much enjoyed our time at ARR and only wished we had a few more days to enjoy the resort and the area.
reviews.title: 2+ Star for a 5 Star Price

reviews.text: The journey for us started 48 hours prior to getting to Sails in the desert, traveling on the overland to Adelaide and then from Adelaide to Alice on the Ghan, then driving 450 kms to get into this desert oasis.
reviews.title: The RED ROCK! :)

reviews.text: The lobby was impressive promising an experience of a lifetime, but so far its just another experience.
reviews.title: Fabulous renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one evening in January. We arrived in the late afternoon and found the AC in the hotel central areas and particularly in the room struggling to keep up with the heat. The central food/beverage areas seem to have been recently refurbished. The rooms were nothing special and it looks like the rooms and hotel areas are well in need of an update. We requested a Kleenex box replacement and it never arrived.
reviews.title: Mediocre service and facility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We kept the room AC operating from 3pm without stopping and the room may have cooled to 85F degrees.
reviews.title: Ayres Rock Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our amazing trip to Australia. We had originally been booked for Th Lost Camel , but this hotel closed, so we opted for the Sails. We were so glad we had to change hotels. This is certainly an oasis in the Desert. Staff we're brilliant. A lovely and very welcoming cold drink while we checked in and regular cold water was offered at the poolside and in the lounge area when we were waiting to be picked up for our onward journey.Bar and Restaurant Staff in particular. Our room was lovely, so comfortable, although it was a little tricky to find, as the signs could have been a bit clearer.
reviews.title: Watch out for guests peering into your Terrace Room !

reviews.text: Booked 3 nights in Terrace Room over Christmas.
reviews.title: Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No sooner were we settled into our room, but another guest had climbed over from her friends neighbouring Terrace room to peer into ours.
reviews.title: Overpriced mediocre hotel where service is a joke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights.Good place to stay. Pool bar convenient for drinks and food after a day of walking. Ilkari buffet dinner excellent. The seafood was good quality. Room service was good also. Short walk to town centre.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: My guide book said it was tired and expensively hyped. Sure it's expensive because its a desert resort but it was modern and smart. Not tired at all. Food very average and rather tasteless but reception allowed us to stay in our room longer than checkout time so we caught a flight out in great comfort. Would come back again, every time.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.text: I went to Sails in the Desert in July this year and it was amazing! The staff were kind and very hospitable, the rooms were clean and spacious with very comfortable beds and it was a lovely walk through the garden to get to the hotel rooms. We were only a short drive away from Uluru, Kata Tjuta, and a short walk from the town shops. Also, you could see Uluru from the entrance of the hotel and some hotel rooms which was special in itself. We all had a great family holiday at Sails in the Desert and I will definitely return soon!
reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our children organized this surprise trip to Uluru for our 30th wedding anniversary. It had always been one of my wishes to visit this amazing area, which didn't disappoint at all. But what brought it all together was our stay at Sails in the Desert. From lobby to room, what a delight to walk through its gardens, or to swim in the pool. Loved those magnificent white gums and all natives! And the room you might ask, well that didn't disappoint either. A bottle of bubbly with a card from the manager greeted us. We had a ground floor, which we loved. Gave us easy access to the pool without any lack of privacy. The king size bed had this most amazing mattress topper that hugged you to sleep after a busy day trekking. Bathroom with double vanity was great and stylish with lots of room to move about. The bathtub is a bit high, which could be an issue for some. But plenty of hot water. A nice wardrobe, tea/coffee making little nook with small bar fridge which had a little ice cub compartment big enough to fit a box of ice cream ;-)). Staff was very helpful. Transport was great. A short walk to market centre with restaurants, cafés, souvenir shops, ATMs,and a handy convenience store. Take away pizza too. Would we go back? ABSOLUTELY!!
reviews.title: Sails was our Oasis!

aka: Sails In The Desert Ayers Rock Hotel
description: Named after the soaring white sails that crown its roof, this is Voyages Ayers Rock Resort's premium hotel. The interior decor focuses on Aboriginal heritage and culture, with a gallery in the lobby and significant artworks featured throughout the public areas and in the private rooms. Slip into comfort right in the heart of the central Australian outback at Voyages Sails in the Desert Hotel. Relax in beautifully appointed rooms, enjoy a cocktail in the lovely grounds, or sit back and relax under the magnificent white sails. The Hotel also features the acclaimed Mulgara Gallery, the lively, buffet-style Winkiku Restaurant, tapas-style cuisine by the pool at Rockpool (seasonal), and the award winning signature restaurant of Voyages Ayers Rock Resort, Kuniya Restaurant.
